name: Magebox 2.0
tagline: A Simple Vagrant Box for Magento 2 with LEMP
body:
## What is Magebox 2.0 (Introduction)
MageBox is a simple [Vagrant][1] Box for [Magento][2] 2 Development with LEMP (Linux, Nginx, MySQL & PHP) & tools like [Composer][3], [Nodejs][4] & [Git][5].
Many Magento 2 developers faces troubles to get Magento 2 running on their local machine & I myself have faced them too. This is Vagrant box is made to save the precious time of Magento developers, so that they can focus on their development instead of configuring LEMP stack for Magento 2.


## What's new in Magebox 2.0 (aka Features)
Magebox 2.0 now has a Nginx as webserver for faster performance. And since Magento 2.0 has support for PHP7, so we are using latest PHP7 instead of older version. Here are tools/software used in Magebox 2.0.
- [Ubuntu 14.04 LTS Trusty Tahir](http://www.ubuntu.com)
- [Nginx v1.4.6](http://nginx.org/en/)
- [MySQL v5.6.30](https://www.mysql.com/)
- [PHP v7.0](http://php.net)
- [Composer v1.1](http://getcomposer.org)
- [Node v5.10.1](https://nodejs.org/en/)
- [NPM v3.8.3](https://www.npmjs.com/)
- [Git v1.9.1](https://git-scm.com)
- [PhpMyAdmin](https://www.phpmyadmin.net/)


## Installation

#### Box Installation
* Download and Install [Vagrant][1]
* Download and Install [VirtualBox][6]
* Clone the MageBox [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/IamSwap/MageBox) ``` git clone https://github.com/IamSwap/MageBox project-name ```
* Change current directory to project ``` cd project-name ```
* Run ``` vagrant up ```
* You can place your project files into ``` public ``` directory or proceed for magento installation
* Access Your Project at  [http://192.168.33.10/][7]

#### Magento Installation
You can place your Magento installation at ``` public ``` directory or follow these steps.
* Run ``` vagrant ssh ```
* Change current directory to ``` cd /home/vagrant/public ```
* Clone Magento Repository ``` git clone -b 2.0 https://github.com/magento/magento2 --depth=1 . ```
* Run ``` composer install ``` & Follow installation [instructions](http://devdocs.magento.com/guides/v2.0/install-gde/prereq/dev_install.html).
* For info follow this tutorial on [How to install Magento in developer machine](https://swapnil.co/blog/magento/install-magento-2/306).



## Basic Vagrant Commands
Here are some useful basic vagrant commands to get you running with Vagrant.

#### Start or resume your server
```bash
vagrant up
```

#### Pause your server
```bash
vagrant suspend
```

#### Delete your server
```bash
vagrant destroy
```

#### SSH into your server
```bash
vagrant ssh
```


## Setting a Hostname
If you would like to use ```http://mage.dev``` as local domain/hostname for your project, just add a record like the following example to your computer's host file.

```bash
192.168.33.10 mage.dev
```

## Database Access

#### MySQL 
- Hostname: localhost or 127.0.0.1
- Username: root
- Password: root
- Database: magento

#### PhpMyAdmin
You can access PhpMyAdmin at [http://192.168.33.10/phpmyadmin/](http://192.168.33.10/phpmyadmin/) or [http://mage.dev/phpmyadmin/](http://mage.dev/phpmyadmin/) after setting hostname. 
- Username: root
- Password: root


## SSH Access
User simple command for ssh into box ``` vagrant ssh ``` or use these credentials
- Hostname: 127.0.0.1:2222
- Username: vagrant
- Password: vagrant

 [4]: https://nodejs.org
